"A.P.241/11/3 10:00": "You spoke with Luther... and he said he'd lend you his power?"
"...<%me>. Is it affecting your body?"
"Oh, what's this? I'm being talked about by the shot callers?"
"Heh, you can relax. I won't be causing trouble any time soon."
"I'm far too fascinated by what goes on in this place inside of you. Why would I bother with some trifling nonsense?"
"You'd best behave as well, you know. It would be bad for you if I had to deal with something. Get me?"
"<%me>...? You went pale all of a sudden. Are you really alright?"
"Perfectly fine."
"Oh no! Luther's taking over!"
"Right. I hope so. I'm just a little worried after you gained Luther's power."
"Really?! W-we have to purify you right away! Clarissa! Clarissa!"
"<%me>, stop teasing her. Especially about something like this."
"So you gained the powers of [Loser] this time... But the data shows no abnormalities. Your Darker Factor hasn't risen either."
"It seems, as with [Elder], there's no imminent danger to deal with."
"We should think of ways to analyze your abilities as well as the situation in Omega."
"It seems Luther shed his mortal form in order to rid himself of the Ephimera from the Crimson Evil Dragon, but..."
"I understand your doubt, Matoi, but this is the truth."
"Omega's Luther had quite a sharp tongue, but he was a good brother who cared about his sister. Right, <%me>?"
"It's as if he was a different person."
"Is that his true personality?"
"Omega is a world recreated from the accounts of the Akashic Record."
"It's entirely possible that Omega's Luther was changed in the process."
"His personality before becoming Dark Falz [Loser] is likely his true personality."
"True personality... Come to think of it, Yucreta said something like that too."
"She said that when she was [Apprentice], it was like she was being manipulated."
"Luther probably thought he could control Dark Falz's power, but ended up being the one controlled."
"Although with things as they are, there's no way to tell if that was really the case, so I don't intend to forgive their actions."
"Something's been on my mind, though. It's about Harriet's past that <%me> saw."
"How is she still alive? Knowing Luther, he likely has some unspeakably grave secrets kept hidden away."
"We should ask Harriet to go into detail about it when she recovers."
"The Investigation of Loser"
"Sibling Memories, the Investigation of Loser"
